subject: Re: [junit] Re: How does Unit test in a heirarchy works...
msgSnippet: No. heirarchical design has nothing to do with heirarchical testing. In my case heirarchical testing made more sense..and hence this thread... And this cannot
messageBody:
No. heirarchical design has nothing to do with heirarchical testing.
In my case heirarchical testing made more sense..and hence this
thread...

And this cannot be generalized for all hierarchical design.

~JAK

On 4/18/05, Chris Dollin <kers@...> wrote:
> On Monday 18 April 2005 13:42, Arun J wrote:
>
> > I mentioned my design has a heirarchical structure and would like to
> > have my tests also have a heirarchical structure for testing this
> > behavior easily.
>
> I don't understand why a hierarchical design requires that the *test
> classes* be hierarchically organised.
>
> --
> Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
>
>
